intro: Gomphia decorans, commonly known as the ornate gomphia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
